ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Wow! this course has opened my eyes to a whole new world (green chemistry) and to a system I did not understand (EPA)
Specific and enhanced knowledge of toxicological concepts, mechanisms of impact, and concepts of modification and green solutions
Much more knowledgable about the toxicity of our environment and green chemistry alternatives.
Learned a ton about toxicology, green chemistry, PFAS, environment impact on animal, ecological and human health; learned about environmental injustices, which I did not realize were so pervasive.
I got a deeper understanding of harms in our world, and how chemicals can be modified to prevent harm.

This course was a great introduction to the field - it covered a breadth of topics with just enough to gain familiarity and understand the field.  The lectures, and particularly, discussion sections helped me understand different perspectives.

An awareness of green chemistry
An appreciation for the complexity of toxic chemicals and the hazards posed by exposure

Loved this class. Every aspect. I had a really busy summer at work so just wish I could have put more time into it because I could have added more value to the discussions and probably enriched my own experience.
Besides Sten's course, this was absolutely the best course I've taken so far. Interesting and challenging.
I really knew nothing about green chemistry so that was fascinating and fun to learn. I had a general knowledge of some of these topics but it was great to do these deeper dives.
I developed an understanding of chemical compounds toxicology and their capacity to be either designed in a green way or to replace the compound with a greener compound.
Ignorance was bliss before taking this course! I'm looking at everything with a critical eye now. But I'm also feeling more empowered by the Green Chemistry aspects of the course.

narratives.question_text: What actions did you take that helped your learning in this course?
comments: completing the readings and videos before class
Get started early on assignments and select paper/homework topics I am genuinely interested in
I participated in all lectures and did the readings
Tried to read as much of the extra reading material as possible.
The discussion posts were helpful in exploring topics more deeply. I also really enjoyed the final paper.
Took notes as I watched the video lectures.

Left adequate time for each assignment and discussion post so that I could get the most out of researching each chemical and each question posed. I didn't always have time to read through the full discussion board after I did my own posts, though, which is regrettable.
I attended all lectures and did the work.

Read the material, watch the videos and show up. You really missed out if you didn't attend live. And I'm really glad I watched the suggested movie in advance -- it made the guest lecture on PFAS so fantastic.
I completed the course readings and lecture videos.
I loved how both instructors brought in lecturers and experts to speak.

extras.title: EHS 541E 01 - Tox Env Chem & Gr Chem Sol
